author: fatima.hussein@indystar.com
title: IMPD looking for serial rapist
text:
IMPD looking for serial rapist Fatima Hussein , fatima.hussein@indystar.com 7:47 p.m. ET Feb. 26, 2017 IMPD released these sketches of a man they believe was involved in three different sexual assaults on Indianapolis' north side. (Photo: IMPD) 236   
The Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department is looking for an alleged serial rapist on the city's north side. 
Sexual assault detectives are looking for a suspect who authorities say committing crimes in and around the 91st and 96th streets between College Avenue and the Monon Trail area in the early morning hours. 
The suspect, who appears to target females that are alone, is described as a Hispanic male, believed to be in his late 20s to early 30s, 5'5" to 5'6" tall, medium build and unshaven. 
There have been three alleged assaults that all fit the suspectâ€™s description in the area. 
Anyone with information are urged to call Crime Stoppers of Central Indiana at 317-262-8477. 
Call IndyStar reporter Fatima Hussein at (317) 444-6209. Follow her on Twitter: @fatimathefatima. Read or Share this story: http://indy.st/2lKeWEB TOP VIDEOS
